Dear Ms. Melendrez:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159
Section (2) The following restraints are strictly prohibited:
Description (e)Restraining youth in a prone position or any restraint that
restricts the youth’s airway.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth was restrained in the prone position.
Investigation This complaint was received on 2/8/2023 and jointly investigated
with the MDHHS Worker. The complaint noted the following:
On 2/6/2023 Youth Worker 1 and Youth Worker 2 had Youth A in
a transport position hold to calm Youth A down. Youth A had spit
on Youth Worker 1. Youth A fell to the ground on his own accord
to get out of the restraint. Youth Worker 2 let go of the restraint
hold at that time to seek further staff assistance. Youth Worker 1
remained with Youth A. Youth Worker 1 was standing over Youth
A with Youth A's arms behind his back. Youth Worker 1 let go of
Youth A after the Supervisor requested for Youth A to be let go.
There is no indication that Youth A sustained any injuries or
bruises during the incident. Youth A is no longer employed at the
group home.
The Youth Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility in
collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Youth Supervisor reported
the incident with Youth A and Youth Worker 1 happened between
4-6pm. She had started her shift at 8:30 am and was getting
ready to end her shift when the incident occurred. Youth A had
escalated and was up and down during her shift. She was in her
office working on medical papers and went out to check on Youth
A. Youth Worker 1 and Youth Worker 2 were said to be with
Youth A in the sensory room. Youth Worker 1 was at the door to
the sensory room and Youth Worker 2 was inside the sensory
room with Youth A. Youth A was calm when Youth Supervisor
checked on them. Youth Supervisor said that Youth Worker 2
2

exited the sensory room as Youth A had de-escalated and Youth
Worker 1 was in the sensory room with Youth A. Youth Worker 2
came to Youth Supervisor's office a bit later and indicated Youth
Worker 1 needed help. Youth Supervisor said she went to the
sensory room and could hear Youth Worker 1 saying, "let go, let
go". The door to the sensory room was closed and Youth Worker
1 and Youth A were in the sensory room together. Youth
Supervisor said she opened the door to the sensory room and
saw Youth Worker 1 standing over Youth A who was prone on the
floor with his hands being held behind his back by Youth Worker
1. Youth Supervisor told Youth Worker 1 to back away and Youth
Worker 1 said Youth A had a hold of his bracelets. Youth
Supervisor indicated she did not see that Youth Worker 1 and
Youth A were joined together by Youth Worker 1's bracelets or
that Youth A was holding them. Youth Supervisor said Youth A
denied being hurt or injured and never complained of pain or
bruises the night of the incident.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility, on 2/9/23, in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth A reported Youth
Worker 1 was mean and he did not like him. Youth A said Youth
Worker 1 was “hitting me when I got a restrained in the sensory
room.” Youth A then showed us his right upper arm inside the
bicep area. There were three bruises on his right upper arm, one
being a circular, dime size, darker bruise, and two above that
bruise that were red and longer in size and shape. Youth A said
Youth Worker 1 “pushed me on the floor and held my hands real
tight behind my back.” Youth A reported Youth Worker 1 was
“pushing me too hard.” Youth A said no other part of his body was
hurt. Scratches were observed on Youth A's right upper cheek.
There was a bruise that was red in color and there appeared to be
three small scratches. Youth A reported another youth on the bus
scratched him on his face. Youth A denied any other marks or
bruises on his body. A small dime size bruise was observed on
Youth A's left forearm. Youth A did not know how he received this
bruise.
Youth Worker 1 was interviewed face to face via zoom on 2/14/23
in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth Worker 1 reported
Youth A came home from school on 2/6/23 really upset. Youth A
was reportedly picking at the other youth. Youth Worker 1
reported Youth A was calling him a brat and said he was going to
leave the facility to go to his mother's house. Youth Worker 1
reported he told Youth A good luck to him as it is cold outside.
Youth A then went out the window. Youth Worker 2 went outside
to get Youth A and Youth Worker 1 was at the entry. Youth
3

Worker 1 said Youth A was swinging at Youth Worker 2. Youth
Worker 1 reported they put Youth A in a team control transport
and escorted Youth A to the sensory room. Youth Worker 1
described the team control transport as Youth Worker 1 being on
one side and Youth Worker 2 being on the other side and placing
one of their arms under Youth A's arm and lifting and carrying
Youth A to the sensory room. Youth Worker 1 reported that Youth
Worker 2 had told him he hurt his shoulder prior to coming to work
that day and he didn't want to put Youth A in a full team control
transport. Youth Worker 1 reported they put Youth A in a standing
team control restraint once inside the sensory room that lasted 2
minutes and then Youth A dropped weight and fell to the ground.
Youth Worker 1 reported Youth Worker 2 left the area to assist
with other youth. Youth Worker 1 said Youth A was sitting on the
floor spitting, cursing, yelling and punching the wall. Youth Worker
2 came into the room again and then left the sensory room and
shut the door behind him leaving Youth Worker 1 and Youth A in
the room alone together. Youth Worker 1 reported Youth A was
still banging on the walls, cursing and yelling. Youth Worker 1
reported Youth A then got up and spit on him. Youth Worker 1
reported he then restrained Youth A in the corner by himself.
Youth Worker 1 reported he learned this from a past employee he
observed do a one-person restraint against the wall. Youth Worker
1 reported he had Youth A's face in the corner. Youth Worker 1
indicated he was not trained in this restraint technique. Youth
Worker 1 reported Youth A was trying to bang his head into Youth
Worker 1's head while he was restraining him. Youth Worker 1
reported that Youth A then fell to the floor and he kept Youth A's
hands behind his back. Youth A was reportedly grabbing at Youth
Worker 1's bracelets and was trying to break them. Youth Worker
1 reported the Youth Supervisor then came into the room and he
told her Youth A had a hold of his bracelets. Youth Worker 1
reported he understands what he did was not right, and he was
trying to protect himself. Youth Worker 1 said he had his knee on
Youth A's back and hands during the restraint. He reported he put
his knee on top of Youth A's hands to get him to let go of Youth
Worker 1's bracelets. Youth Worker 1 denied he put any weight
on Youth A's back and said he was doing it to secure Youth A.
Youth Worker 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
2/14/23 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. He reported that
Youth A was having a difficult day on 2/6/23 and that Youth A had
jumped out the window. Youth Worker 2 reported he and Youth
Worker 1 brought Youth A inside and took him to the sensory
room to remove all external noise. Youth Worker 2 reported he
then left the sensory room and Youth Worker 1 stayed there.
4

Youth Worker 2 reported it began to get noisy in the sensory
room, so he went back in, and Youth A was attempting to punch
and kick Youth Worker 1. Youth Worker 2 reported he began to
rub Youth A's back to calm him and then he left the sensory room
after Youth A had calmed. Youth Worker 2 reported it then began
to get loud again in the sensory room, so he went and got the
Youth Supervisor. Youth Worker 2 reported the Youth Supervisor
opened the sensory room door and he briefly saw Youth Worker 1
standing over Youth A who was on the floor with his hands being
held behind his back.
Youth Worker 2 described using a transport hold when they
moved Youth A into the sensory room. Youth Worker 2 reported
they each had their arm under Youth A's arm and held Youth A's
wrist to move him. Youth Worker 2 reported he was not sure if
they lifted Youth A off the ground to move him or not, and further
reported it is hard to know with the height differences. Youth
Worker 2 reported they restrained Youth A once when Youth A
was inside the sensory room. Youth Worker 2 reported Youth A's
back was to the wall and Youth Worker 2 was on the right side of
Youth A holding his wrist and Youth Worker 1 was on the left side
holding Youth A's wrist. Youth Worker 2 reported he was standing
next to Youth A with his feet next to him. Youth Worker 2 reported
they counted backwards from 3 and then let Youth A go after
restraining him.
Youth Worker 2 couldn't remember if Youth A fell to the ground or
was released. Youth Worker 2 reported Youth A went to the
corner of the room after the restraint. Youth Worker 2 denied
Youth A being injured or having any injuries from the transport or
restraint. Youth A did not report any injuries to Youth Worker 2 at
the debriefing. Youth Worker 2 has been employed with Adrian
Group Home since July and completed CPI training. He reported
that they initiate a restraint if a youth is being destructive or is
harming themself or others.
Youth Worker 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
2/14/23 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth Worker 3
works full time at the facility usually working second shifts from 2-
11pm. Youth Worker 3 reported that Youth A was having a hard
time on 2/6/23 when he got off the school bus. She reported Youth
A jumped out of his window and Youth Workers 1 and 2 had to
bring him back into the building. They took Youth A into the
sensory room and then Youth Worker 2 came out. Youth Worker 3
reported Youth Worker 1 and Youth A were in the sensory room
for a while. Youth Worker 3 then reported about an hour later the
5

Youth Supervisor called Youth Worker 1 into her office. Youth
Worker 3 reported Youth Workers 1 and 2 used the team control
transfer hold to move Youth A into the sensory room. Youth
Workers 1 and 2 had their arm inside Youth A's elbow and held
onto his hands. Youth Worker 3 was unsure if Youth A was
dragged or walked willingly into the sensory room. Youth Worker 3
denied seeing any injuries or bruises on Youth A. Youth Worker 3
reported she heard Youth A was restrained at school and she
heard about the bruise on Youth A's inner bicep. Youth Worker 3
denied ever doing or being trained in a single person restraint and
said their policy does not allow it. She indicated they are not
allowed to pull or lift the youth.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage on 2/6/23, in the sensory room at the facility was
reviewed on 2/9/23. The video provided of the incident was of
Youth Worker 1, Youth A and the Youth Supervisor. The transport
of Youth A into the sensory room and restraint by Youth Workers
1 and 2 was not available on video and could not be recalled. The
facility reported it was not available as too much time had passed.
The video reviewed showed Youth Worker 1 sitting in a chair in
front of the sensory room door which is closed. Youth A is sitting
on the floor across the room by the chalkboard painted wall. Youth
A is pounding his fists, arms, elbows, and head against the
chalkboard wall. He gets up on his knees and pounds the side of
his fist against the chalkboard wall and then sits down again.
Youth A then stands up and spits twice towards Youth Worker 1
and sits back down on the floor with his back to Youth Worker 1.
Youth Worker 1 gets up quickly from his chair and picks Youth A
up off the ground by placing his hands under Youth A's armpits
and lifting him to a standing position. Youth Worker 1 places
Youth A in the corner of the room in a standing position and holds
him there for approximately two minutes. Youth A cannot be seen
in the video once he is moved to the corner. Youth Worker 1's
feet are visible, and you can see him place his foot against Youth
A's feet to keep him from moving. After approximately two
minutes Youth A comes to the ground face down and the right
side of his body is against the wall. Youth Worker 1 has Youth A's
hands behind his back, and he is standing over Youth A who is
prone on the ground. Youth Worker 1's legs are straddled over
Youth A. Youth A is struggling to move and kicking his legs. Youth
Worker 1 holds Youth A in this position for approximately two and
a half minutes. For sixteen seconds Youth Worker 1 has his knee
on top of Youth A's hands, which are behind his back. Youth
Worker 1 let's go of Youth A when the Youth Supervisor enters the
room. The Youth Supervisor helps Youth A into a sitting position
6

and Youth Worker 1 exits the sensory room. Youth A grabs at
Youth Worker 1 as he exits the room. Youth A is sitting on the
floor with the Youth Supervisors' hands on his shoulders when
Youth Worker 1 exits the room and the video ends.
Documentation reviewed:
Incident report 2/6/22-authored by Youth Specialist 2 indicates
Youth A escalated about 4:15pm as he was extremely upset
because he couldn't go home. Youth A began to scream at staff
and jumped out the window. He was brought back inside by Youth
Workers 1 and 2 and went to the sensory room. Youth A
escalated more and was spitting on staff, threatening to hurt staff,
and screaming. He was placed in a high-level hold by Youth
Workers 1 and 2 as he posed safety risk to himself and others.
After 5 minutes Youth A was calm and agreed to sit in the corner
for 5 minutes and then come out. After hearing this Youth worker
2 exited the sensory room.
Incident Report dated 2/6/23 5:05pm authored by Youth
Supervisor-indicates Youth Supervisor entered the sensory room
and Youth Worker 1 was standing over Youth A and asking him to
let him go. Youth Supervisor went to take a closer look and assist
Youth Worker 1 with freeing himself, however Youth A had
already let go. Youth A was on the floor, so Youth Supervisor
directed Youth Worker 1 to back up. Youth Supervisor de-
escalated Youth A at which point he stood up. Youth Supervisor
asked Youth Worker 1 to exit the area. Youth A proceeded to
bang on the walls and the door then asked for water. Youth A
was provided water and Youth Worker 2 was switched out with
Youth Supervisor and provided support to further de-escalate
Youth A.
Medical examination of Youth A- Adrian Urgent Care completed
an examination on 2/9/23 at the request of the government
worker. The exam indicates scratches on Youth A's right cheek
which he reported was from an incident yesterday at the group
home. Youth A had multiple bruises and scratches on his body.
Tenderness was noted in both shoulders and x-rays were
completed. X-rays did not reveal any injuries. Youth A reported to
the urgent care staff that the school staff pinches him on the arms
to get him to move.
Heath status screening with Youth A was completed on 2/6/23 @
5:05 by Youth Worker 2. There were no noted injuries or bruises
on Youth A and he reported he was very angry but was feeling
better and calm.
7

Adrian Group Home physical restraint interventions policy was
reviewed- policy outlines the agencies approved and unapproved
behavioral intervention methods and follow up procedures after an
intervention. The policy outlines that all physical restraint
interventions are performed by two staff members and no
individual staff member will perform a restraint by themselves and
that physical restraint shall be limited to situations of serious self-
harm or injury to others. The policy does not provide for prone
restraints, lifting, or carrying youth.
Youth Worker 1's training hours were reviewed, and he completed
8 hours of CPI training on 7/19/2022.
Youth Worker 2's training hours were reviewed, and he completed
CPI training on 12/13/22 and 12/18/23.
Analysis The facility is in violation of the rule. Youth Worker 1 was
observed in the video footage to have Youth A in a one-person
restraint against the wall and then moved to having Youth A prone
on the floor with his hands behind his back. Youth Worker 1
admitted he used restraint techniques that were not allowed and
that he was not trained in. The Youth Supervisor and Youth
Worker 2 both observed Youth Worker 1 standing over Youth A
holding him prone on the ground with his hands being held behind
his back. Youth A reported Youth Worker 1 pushed him on the
floor and held his hands real tight behind his back.
The facility is in violation of their physical restraint interventions
policy. Youth Worker 1 performed a one-person restraint that
ended with Youth A prone on the floor. This is not in line with the
rule or agency policy.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & R 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction, prevention;
Section prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Description (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth’s behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
condition, and personal history, including any history of trauma,
and must be done in a manner consistent with the youth’s
treatment plan.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff member did not follow the agency’s restraint policy.
8

Investigation Refer to above content related to this incident of restraint.
Analysis Youth Worker 1 lifted/carried the youth when transporting, placed
Youth A in a one-person restraint, held the youth with his face in
the corner, and used a prone restraint while holding the youth's
hands behind his back. He acknowledged using techniques not
taught in his restraint training. These restraint methods are not in
line with the agency restraint model or the rule and were unsafe
and inappropriate. Staff must only use approved restraint
techniques.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of Staff
Section The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A was suspended from school and the facility was unable to
pick up Youth A due to not having enough staff.
Investigation An additional complaint was received on 2/9/23 involving Adrian
Group Home and Youth A. The complaint noted the following:
Youth A (8) is in foster care and placed at the Adrian Group
Home. He attends Laura Haviland School. On 2/8/23, the group
home was called and asked to pick Youth A up early from school
due to him having issues there. Staff were not able to pick him up
early, so law enforcement, that was already at the school, brought
him home. Youth A has bruising on his upper right bicep. He
indicated being restrained at the school and his arm being
pinched. It's unclear who caused this as he first stated the police
did it and then stated teachers at the school.
Youth Supervisor reported on 2/8/23 the school called and said
Youth A was escalated and asked could someone come get him.
There was another youth home sick that day and the Youth
Supervisor was the only staff at the facility. She reported she
indicated to the school it would take about one to one and a half
hours to get staff in to come get Youth A. Approximately 10:45am
the police showed up with Youth A to drop him off. Youth
Supervisor reported that the police are sometimes at the school
and help out and that was the case this day. Youth A was calm
when he arrived home with the police. Youth A was hungry, so
9

Youth Supervisor made him lunch and attempted to find out what
happened at school from Youth A. He reported his stomach hurt
and he couldn't play the math game, so he wanted to come home.
Youth Supervisor said the agency’s compliance officer arrived at
the facility shortly after Youth A arrived home. She was there to
see Youth A and for another scheduled meeting. Youth A showed
the compliance officer a bruise on his right underarm bicep area.
The Youth Supervisor said the facility also had a staff meeting and
training that day and staff were switching in and out with
monitoring the two youth and doing the training. The Youth
Supervisor reported the Director was with the two youth that were
home that day and Youth A was picking at and antagonizing
Youth B. The Supervisor reported she was coming out of the
training room and saw Youth B running down the hallway after
Youth A. The Director and the Supervisor followed them, and
Youth B reportedly had ahold of Youth A and had him pinned
against the wall. Her hand was on top of Youth A's head, and she
was pushing it into the wall. The Supervisor reported she was able
to place her hand in front of Youth A's head and was able to move
him out and separate the youth.
The Youth Supervisor reported she and the Director took Youth A
to urgent care on 2/9/23 at the request of the Government Worker.
Youth A reportedly said his shin bruise was from the restraint
done on 2/6/23. The Supervisor reported Youth A said the bruise
on his arm/bicep area was from school. The Supervisor reported
that Youth A said teachers pinch him to move him and that is how
he got the injuries on his arm. The Youth Supervisor reported this
to centralized intake. The Youth Supervisor reported she did not
see Youth A's upper arm after he was restrained on 2/6/23 or
before the school incident on 2/8/23. The Youth Supervisor
became aware of Youth A's bruised upper arm/bicep when he
showed the compliance officer on 2/8/23.
Youth A said the police brought him home yesterday from school
and they were mad at him. Youth A refused to discuss what
happened at school and then said he was restrained at school,
and they pinched him. Youth A indicated he didn't know who
restrained him at school and he then showed us the same bruise
on his arm.
Documentation reviewed:
The staffing requirements and supervision policy was reviewed.
Policy outlines the minimum staffing requirements and supervision
of clients is maintained at each location. Each location has a
written schedule that includes provisions for use of relief staff and
10

a backup plan for emergencies. The Youth Supervisor reported
she called the staff that had just left from third shift and additional
staff who were unable to come into work to assist with picking up
Youth A.
School Incident reports, school time out logs, and a school
seclusion report were reviewed from 2/7/23 and 2/8/23. All
reports outline Youth A's aggressive and defiant behaviors at
school.
Incident report dated 2/8/23 @ 2:20pm- authored by the Director.
Youth A was antagonizing Youth B and took the coloring book
from her and threw it at her. Youth A ran down the hall and Youth
B chased after him and pinned him against the wall and was
pressing his head against the wall. Youth A said his head hurt. He
was offered ice and declined. Youth A has a scratch on his right
temple from fighting with peer.
Incident report dated 2/8/23 @ 4pm authored by the compliance
coordinator -the compliance coordinator was at the facility and
noticed a bruise on Youth A's upper arm. Youth A reported the
bruise came from school staff that did it that morning while trying
to restrain him. He also reported the police pulled him by his ears
while getting him to their car to take him home.
Analysis The facility is not in violation of the rule. Although there was not
extra staff at the facility to immediately go pick up the youth, due
to a youth being at the facility ill, the facility gave a 1-1/2 hour
timeframe to the school for them to come and pick him up. This is
a reasonable and prudent timeframe.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE: The staff requirement and
supervision policy indicate each location will have a schedule with
relief staff and a backup plan for emergencies. The schedule has
a number to call for emergencies and no information regarding
relief staff. The agency needs to have an emergency plan and
relief staff in place based on their policy.
Conclusion Violation Not Established.
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112
Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
Description (a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
11

Allegation Staff member received a confirmed case for Improper
Supervision.
Investigation Youth Worker 1 placed Youth A in a prone restraint while holding
the youth's hands behind his back. This is a restricted restraint
which could have resulted in injuries or asphyxiation. asphyxiation.
Analysis Youth Worker 1's behavior is evidence that he doesn't have the
ability to perform the duties of his assigned position.
The Government Worker deemed Youth Worker 1 unsuitable to
work with children.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
